projects.name: Onboard Pro - Developer Onboarding Tool
projects.description: A cross-platform command-line developer onboarding tool written in C# that automates the setup of consistent development environments across Windows, macOS, Ubuntu, and WSL. The tool uses dependency injection for testability, implements platform-specific orchestrators, and provides idempotent onboarding steps. Migrating from a monolithic PowerShell script to a maintainable, testable, and extensible C# architecture.

tasks.name: Iteration 18: Hardening Diagnostics and Prerequisite Handling
tasks.details: Fix critical bugs in diagnostic and system-check layers: resolve verbose mode UI crash and overhaul WSL prerequisite check with UAC elevation support. Expand test coverage for UI and process execution.

tasks.name: 10 Planning
tasks.details: Prepare the development environment for Iteration 18 work by creating the feature branch.

tasks.name: 20 Build & Document
tasks.details: Implement all code changes, unit tests, and documentation updates for the verbose mode fix, WSL prerequisite check overhaul, and test coverage expansion.

tasks.name: 30 Local Validation
tasks.details: Run full test suite with linting and perform dry-run validation before pushing changes.

tasks.name: 40 Delivery & CI
tasks.details: Push changes, open pull request, and monitor CI pipeline until all checks pass.

tasks.name: Create iteration branch "iter-18"
tasks.details: Create a new feature branch named 'iter-18' from the current main branch to isolate all Iteration 18 changes.

tasks.name: Fix verbose mode UI crash - escape [DEBUG] markup
tasks.details: In SpectreUserInteraction.cs WriteDebug method, escape the [DEBUG] string by changing '[grey][DEBUG]...' to '[grey][[DEBUG]]...' to prevent Spectre.Console from interpreting it as a style instruction.

tasks.name: Enhance IProcessRunner interface for elevation support
tasks.details: Add a new optional boolean parameter 'requestElevation = false' to the RunAsync method signature in IProcessRunner.cs to enable steps to request elevated privileges.

tasks.name: Implement RunElevatedWindowsAsync with UAC spot elevation
tasks.details: Refactor RunAsync in ProcessRunner.cs to route based on requestElevation flag. If true, call new RunElevatedWindowsAsync method that: creates temp file, constructs PowerShell command with 'runas' verb to trigger UAC, redirects output to temp file, waits for completion, reads output, cleans up temp file, and returns ProcessResult.

tasks.name: Update EnableWslFeaturesStep to use elevated dism.exe checks
tasks.details: Update EnableWslFeaturesStep.cs IsFeatureEnabledAsync method to use dism.exe with requestElevation: true. Check both Microsoft-Windows-Subsystem-Linux and VirtualMachinePlatform features. Overall prerequisite passes only if both features are enabled AND Ubuntu distribution is found.

tasks.name: Create SpectreUserInteraction test suite with UI rendering tests
tasks.details: Add Spectre.Console.Testing NuGet package to Onboard.Core.Tests project. Create SpectreUserInteractionTests.cs file with tests using TestConsole. Write regression test for WriteDebug that verifies literal [DEBUG] string appears without exceptions. Add tests for WriteSuccess, WriteError, WriteWarning to validate expected markup output.

tasks.name: Update EnableWslFeaturesStep tests to verify elevation intent
tasks.details: Update EnableWslFeaturesStep unit tests to verify that IProcessRunner.RunAsync is called with requestElevation parameter set to true for dism.exe commands. This validates the step correctly requests the elevation it needs.

tasks.name: Update architecture documentation
tasks.details: Update architecture documentation to reflect the new UAC spot elevation pattern in ProcessRunner, the enhanced IProcessRunner interface, and the improved WSL prerequisite detection strategy using dism.exe.

tasks.name: Run full test suite
tasks.details: Execute 'dotnet test' to run the full test suite and verify all unit tests pass, including the new SpectreUserInteraction tests and updated EnableWslFeaturesStep tests.

tasks.name: Verify clean build with no warnings
tasks.details: Run 'dotnet build' with appropriate flags to verify the solution builds without warnings or errors.

tasks.name: Manual smoke test of verbose mode
tasks.details: Perform a manual smoke test of the verbose mode flag to confirm the [DEBUG] crash is resolved and output renders correctly.

tasks.name: Open PR: iter-18
tasks.details: Push the iter-18 branch to the remote repository and create a pull request with a detailed description of the verbose mode fix and WSL prerequisite improvements.

tasks.name: Monitor CI & Resolve Failures
tasks.details: Monitor the CI pipeline execution. If any checks fail, investigate logs, make necessary fixes, commit, push, and repeat until all CI checks pass (green status). This is the final active task for autonomous execution.

tasks.name: Iteration 19: Windows Developer Experience Parity
tasks.details: Implement the Windows developer parity scope from prds/iterations/iteration19.md, ensuring VS Code remote tooling, dotfiles bootstrap, GitHub authentication, and Docker Desktop integration reach feature-complete parity with the legacy Windows bootstrapper. Follow Fire-and-Forget standards so the iteration ends with a green PR.

tasks.name: 10 Planning
tasks.details: Prepare the workspace for iteration 19 by following the planning checklist before any implementation work begins.

tasks.name: 20 Build & Document
tasks.details: Deliver all iteration 19 code, tests, and documentation updates required for Windows developer experience parity before validation begins.

tasks.name: 30 Local Validation
tasks.details: Run the full local validation gauntlet for iteration 19 before handing off to CI.

tasks.name: 40 Delivery & CI
tasks.details: Push iteration 19 for review and ensure remote automation finishes green.

tasks.name: Create iteration branch "iter-19"
tasks.details: Branch from the latest main into iter-19 before any implementation work, pushing the branch to origin once created.

tasks.name: Add VS Code Remote Development extension provisioning
tasks.details: Create a Windows onboarding step that uses IProcessRunner to detect ms-vscode-remote.vscode-remote-extensionpack via `code --list-extensions` and installs it with `code --install-extension` when missing. Ensure status output is surfaced through IUserInteraction and guard the step for idempotency. Cover skip vs install paths with unit tests.

tasks.name: Implement VS Code dotfiles bootstrap configuration
tasks.details: Build a Windows step that reads %APPDATA%/Code/User/settings.json through IFileSystem, prompts for a dotfiles repository (custom value, default kevinaud/dotfiles, or skip), and persists dotfiles.repository plus optional dotfiles.targetPath without disturbing other settings. Ensure idempotent behavior when configuration exists and add tests covering all prompt branches.

tasks.name: Pre-authenticate Git Credential Manager with GitHub
tasks.details: Introduce a Windows onboarding step that probes for cached GitHub credentials using git-credential-manager.exe with GCM_INTERACTIVE=never and, when absent, launches `gh auth login --hostname github.com --git-protocol https --web`. Mirror the command flow outlined in prds/git_auth_reference.md, surface clear messaging, and mock gh/GCM calls in unit tests for both skip and login scenarios.

tasks.name: Synchronize Docker Desktop WSL integration
tasks.details: Create a Windows step that loads %APPDATA%/Docker/settings-store.json via IFileSystem, ensures the selected WSL distro from earlier steps appears in IntegratedWslDistros, writes updates atomically, and restarts Docker Desktop only when changes occur. Respect idempotency and add tests for no-op, append, and restart-required paths.

tasks.name: Integrate new steps into Windows orchestrator and UX
tasks.details: Register the new Windows steps in logical order within WindowsOrchestrator, ensure summary tables and messaging account for remote tooling, dotfiles, GCM auth, and Docker integration, and update orchestrator/unit tests to reflect the expanded sequence and branching behaviors.

tasks.name: Implement/update unit tests
tasks.details: Expand automated coverage to exercise the new Windows onboarding steps, including install/no-op flows, user prompt branches, GCM authentication, Docker integration, and orchestrator sequencing.

tasks.name: Update architecture documentation
tasks.details: Refresh architecture and onboarding docs to capture the new Windows remote tooling, dotfiles, GCM auth, and Docker integration behaviors plus any new CLI dependencies.

tasks.name: Local full-suite lint/test & dry-run
tasks.details: Run dotnet format, dotnet build, dotnet test, and a Windows onboarding dry run to confirm the new steps execute or skip appropriately before opening the PR.

tasks.name: Open PR: iter-19
tasks.details: Push iter-19, open the PR with a full summary of Windows parity work, and ensure tests/docs are linked in the description.

tasks.name: Monitor CI & Resolve Failures
tasks.details: Watch the iter-19 PR automation and push follow-up fixes until all CI checks report success; this is the final active task for the iteration.
